SEARCH
Module paths
Package ntnu.idatt2001.ejhaslerjorgfi.model

Class Player

java.lang.Object
ntnu.idatt2001.ejhaslerjorgfi.model.Player
public class Player extends Object

Player

Definition

Represents the main character of a Game which will be interacting with the Story. A Player object will act as an intermediary between the user of the application and the Story to unfold. It contains different attributes which can be affected by the actions performed in the Story.

Functionality

An instance of the Player class has a name, health, score, an amount of gold, and an inventory of items. It is also capabale of altering these values as a result of different events occuring in the Story.

Attributes

A Player object has a name field which holds the name of the Player in the Story.

Each Player will have a non-negative amount of health points stored in its health field. It indicates the health of the Player. Should the Player have zero health points, it means that the Player is dead.

The Player may receive score points indicating the Player's success througout the Story. The points are stored in the score field.

Player objects can hold a given amount of gold which acts as a currency in the Story. Gold may be awarded the Player upon completing different events.

A Player can hold several items in its inventory. The items are represented as Strings, and each item may provide a certain perk of functionality to the Player.

Since:
12.02.2023
Version:
05.03.2023
Author:
Group 24

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(String name, int health, int score, int gold)
      Creates a new instance of the Player class with a given name, amount of health points, amount of score points, amount of gold and a collection of items which the Player has in its inventory.
      Parameters:
      name - The name is a string and the name of the Player..
      health - Health value of the Player represented as health points.
      score - Score value of the Player represented as score points.
      gold - Amount of gold held by the Player.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If the name parameter has the value 'null'.
      BlankStringException - If the name argument is either an empty string or consist of only white spaces. Utilizes the .blank() method of the String-class.
      NegativeIntegerException - If the Integer values of health, score, or gold is less than zero {Integer-values invalid input: '<' 0}.
